com.mongodb
Class MongoAuthority

java.lang.Object
  com.mongodb.MongoAuthority

@Immutable
 class MongoAuthority
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents the authority to which this client is connecting. It includes both the server address(es) and optional authentication credentials. The class name is informed by the URI RFC, which refers to the username/host/port part of a URI as the "authority".

Since:
2.11.0

Constructor Detail

MongoAuthority

private MongoAuthority(java.util.List<ServerAddress> serverAddresses,
                       MongoAuthority.Type type,
                       MongoCredentialsStore credentialsStore)
Constructs an instance with a list of server addresses, which may either be a list of mongos servers or a list of members of a replica set, and a store of authentication credentials.

Parameters:
serverAddresses - the server addresses
credentialsStore - the credentials store

MongoAuthority

private MongoAuthority(ServerAddress serverAddress,
                       MongoCredentialsStore credentialsStore)
Constructs an instance with a single server address and a store of authentication credentials. This will be a direct connection, even if it's part of a replica set.

Parameters:
serverAddress - the server address of a mongo server
